page.title: 18SCHOOL TRIPS
page.content: Class 1 made a trip to Paradise Park in Hayle, Cornwall. Paradise Park is a conservation and breeding centre for beautiful and rare birds together with rare breeds of pigs, sheep, goats and poultry. Class 2 visited Restormel Castle, a 13th Century castle ruins now owned by the English Heritage Trust, and then went on to Dobwalls miniature railroad. Class 3 trip included a visit to Buckfast Butterfly Farm, where exotic butterflies and moths breed, together with a ride on the Buckfastleigh steam train.
